name: places/ChIJL0MeGLJQwokRr_n3SRPjq3Y
formattedAddress: 104 W 40th St Suite 416, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 104 W 40th St Suite 416, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text:
Soho/spruce online platform  has been paramount in taking care of my mental health since I relocated to NYC a little over a year ago.

It’s easy and convenient to schedule appointments or request medication refills through the chat (following an appointment) or communicate with your care provider through spruce. Someone will respond on the chat pretty much always.

So far I’ve had a really great experience. The only thing I would change is the bi-weekly policy.  Once you hit a good place with treatment, dialing back appointments is pretty typical.  Soho requires you to see your therapist twice a month at minimum.

It’s easy and convenient to schedule appointments or request medication refills through the chat (following an appointment) or communicate with your care provider through spruce. Someone will respond on the chat pretty much always.

So far I’ve had a really great experience. The only thing I would change is the bi-weekly policy.  Once you hit a good place with treatment, dialing back appointments is pretty typical.  Soho requires you to see your therapist twice a month at minimum.

originalText.text: In January 2023 I knew I needed some mental health help. From then until June I saw several different therapists and didn’t actually get any help.  Just talk for a half hour then have someone say they couldn’t help me, and then start all over again.  When I contacted SohoMD it was different right from the start. They got me an appointment within a reasonable amount of time. Linda, the nurse practitioner who sees me, is smart, caring, and excellent at helping me communicate better so I can not spend the rest of my life feeling so unheard. I feel like I’m getting the help I need now. I have a therapist in a different practice who is helping me with the trauma. And I have Linda with SohoMD helping me with medical management of my difficulties. It’s hard to write a review on something as personal as mental health.  Obviously I don’t want to give specific examples of how Linda has helped me move out of this bad mental place. She has. And she’s helping me take steps toward actually getting better, not just covering over symptoms with medications. It’s hard. All of this is hard. What makes it doable is that on appointment day, Linda is there and focused on helping me. And the support staff at SohoMD are responsive and easy to contact. I sent them a message at the beginning of typing this review asking them what month I had my first appointment with Linda because I didn’t remember. They have already answered me back. It’s comforting knowing that the people who are there to help me are actually…there. I highly recommend SohoMD and Linda.

originalText.text: I loved my provider from Soho MD! Dealing with the office used to be great, but for the last few months I get entirely ghosted between appointments. I know they're switching over to a new system but all calls go straight to voice-mail and no platform gets a response. To get a refill of my meds I had to resort to DMing their Instagram page.

text.text: I loved my provider from Soho MD! Dealing with the office used to be great, but for the last few months I get entirely ghosted between appointments. I know they're switching over to a new system but all calls go straight to voice-mail and no platform gets a response. To get a refill of my meds I had to resort to DMing their Instagram page.

originalText.text: My wife really likes her psychiatrist here but they overbill us almost every time. They charge our stored credit card as soon as she has the appointment instead of waiting to bill us after insurance processes the claim. This billing practice should be illegal. I have contacted their office multiple times to get it resolved without any luck. They always eventually refund us but we have to contact them every single time it happens.

originalText.text: This has been the WORST experience I have had with a clinic in my entire life. Stay AWAY from this place at all cost. You are required to send messages via an app that goes unanswered for days. When you call the office nobody picks up, so it's basically impossible to get a hold of someone to request a simple refill. You don't have any direct contact with your provided. It should be criminal to run a practice that handles medication management this way. They really don't care about their patients at all. You have been warned!
